extendedIngredients.name: bitter melon
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups bitter melon, cut in half lengthwise, seeds and membrane removed, cut into ¼ inch slices
metaInformation: cut in half lengthwise, seeds and membrane removed,

extendedIngredients.name: chile garlic sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons black bean and garlic sauce (I used Dynasty brand)- *May substitute 3 tablespoons whole fermented black beans, rinsed then mashed

extendedIngredients.name: cornstarch
extendedIngredients.originalString: Slurry- 2 teaspoons cornstarch, plus ¼ cup cold water, mixed together

extendedIngredients.name: pork loin
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound pork loin, sliced thin against the grain, 2 inch strips

extendedIngredients.name: red bell peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup red bell peppers cut into 2-inch strips

extendedIngredients.name: red chilies
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 dried red chilies, seeded and chopped

extendedIngredients.name: yellow bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup yellow bell pepper, cut into 2-inch strips

extendedIngredients.name: yellow onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup yellow onions, sliced into 2-inch slices

recipes.title: Stir-fried Bitter Melon
recipes.instructions: In a medium sized bowl, combine ingredients for the black bean sauce; garlic, ginger, black bean and garlic sauce (or mashed black beans), dried chilies, rice wine, soy sauce, salt, sugar and water. Set aside.Combine slurry ingredients; cornstarch and water, and set aside.In a medium sized bowl, combine pork with soy sauce, cornstarch, sugar and wine. Set aside.Heat wok over high heat, and then add the 2 tablespoons of oil. Add ginger slices and fry for 1 minute, then discard. Add the pork and cook for 2 minutes or until no longer raw, stirring constantly. Place the cooked pork in a bowl and reserve. Turn off the heat.Heat the wok over high heat (there may be some residual coating on the bottom from the pork, as long as its not burnt, you can cook the vegetables in the wok without cleaning in between, this will actually add more flavor and will dissolve once the slurry is added).  Add the 2 tablespoons of oil.Add the sliced bitter melon and fry for 5 minutes over high heat, ensuring to stir constantly. The melon should be tender yet slightly crisp.Add the sliced onions, stir-fry for 1 minute.Add the bell peppers, stir-fry for 1 minute.Add the sliced mushrooms, stir-fry for 1 minute.Add the black bean sauce and cook for 1 minute.Turn off the heat, remix the cornstarch slurry, and then add to the wok. Stir the slurry quickly into the stir-fry, this will help prevent clumpy and thicken the sauce. Add more water to the wok if needed to thin out the sauce to your liking. Turn the heat to low, simmer for 1 minute, then add back the cooked pork. Stir the pork into the stir-fry and cook until the pork is warmed. Season the stir-fry with salt and pepper as desired. Serve immediately, enjoy!

steps.step: In a medium sized bowl, combine ingredients for the black bean sauce; garlic, ginger, black bean and garlic sauce (or mashed black beans), dried chilies, rice wine, soy sauce, salt, sugar and water. Set aside.
Combine slurry ingredients; cornstarch and water, and set aside.In a medium sized bowl, combine pork with soy sauce, cornstarch, sugar and wine. Set aside.
Heat wok over high heat, and then add the 2 tablespoons of oil.
Add ginger slices and fry for 1 minute, then discard.
Add the pork and cook for 2 minutes or until no longer raw, stirring constantly.
Place the cooked pork in a bowl and reserve. Turn off the heat.

Heat the wok over high heat (there may be some residual coating on the bottom from the pork, as long as its not burnt, you can cook the vegetables in the wok without cleaning in between, this will actually add more flavor and will dissolve once the slurry is added).
Add the sliced bitter melon and fry for 5 minutes over high heat, ensuring to stir constantly. The melon should be tender yet slightly crisp.
Add the sliced onions, stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add the bell peppers, stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add the sliced mushrooms, stir-fry for 1 minute.

Add the black bean sauce and cook for 1 minute.Turn off the heat, remix the cornstarch slurry, and then add to the wok. Stir the slurry quickly into the stir-fry, this will help prevent clumpy and thicken the sauce.

Add more water to the wok if needed to thin out the sauce to your liking. Turn the heat to low, simmer for 1 minute, then add back the cooked pork. Stir the pork into the stir-fry and cook until the pork is warmed. Season the stir-fry with salt and pepper as desired.
